messages.subject: Re: Re: Yet Another Reason to Homeschool
messages.msgSnippet: ... in ... partially ... her ... started ... this ... planned a ... Wow! That s horrible. ... The sad thing is that I CAN imagine it! A lot of the bus drivers
messages.messageBody:
> Here is another one. Tuesday, a 13 yo girl was on her way to school here
in
> Port Huron, MI. Holland Woods Middle School backs up to the local
partially
> wooded park. As she cut through the park, a man approached her. He asked
her
> why she wasn't in school. She said that she was not allowed to talk to
> strangers, and he hit her in the head several times. She hit a tree,
started
> yelling, and hitting back. He ran away, and has not been caught. BTW,
this
> is the same school that became a national media target when 4 boys
planned a
> pep rally massacre and bomb was found...
Wow! That's horrible.

> I heard one around here too...
> A bus driver got fed up with the kids on his bus. He stopped the bus
> and made all the kids get out and walk home!
> There were kids of several ages on this bus.
The sad thing is that I CAN imagine it! A lot of the bus drivers around here
are nasty...and I can actually see a few of them doing it. I've even heard
it threatened. I went to public school and have heard things like that
before...and when I was in Kindergarten, the bus driver missed my stop...but
a few houses up (we lived in a pretty "rural" area and that was VERY far),
one of the parents said they knew me and my parents...so the bus driver put
me off there!

Anyway...things are just too crazy. We have considered sending the children
to high school...but I'm not so sure any more.

~`*S*`~
